p:
Differences in the degree of aggregation, at 90% relative humidity, between three species of isopods differing in their adaptations to reduce water loss in the terrestrial environment, are shown in Fig. 3.
Oniscus asellus
(Linnaeus, 1758) was most susceptible to water loss, the
Armadillidium vulgare
(Latreille, 1804) is morphologically the best adapted to withstand desiccation while
Porcellio scaber
(Latreille, 1804) has an intermediate level of morphological adaptation but also uses aggregation as a key behavioural tactic in its overall desiccation avoidance strategy.
